name: imprimatur
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
official permission to do something that is given by a person or group in a position of power: imprimatur of When he suspended the constitution and dissolved Congress, he had the imprimatur of the armed forces. Synonym
endorsementCompare
sanction noun
warrant noun

official approval of something or permission to do something: Some of the largest investment banks also provide an imprimatur of business respectability on the borrower.
official permission to publish a book: The Guide was published with the imprimatur of the U.S. architectural industry group.
